context: The Estonian word 'südame' is the genitive case form of 'süda', which means 'heart'. In Estonian grammar, the genitive case indicates possession or relationship - so 'südame' literally means 'of heart' or 'belonging to the heart'. This form is commonly used in phrases like describing characteristics of the heart ('Südamel on üheksa liigest' - The heart has nine joints) or when talking about heart-related issues ('Kuidas sind südame valutab?' - How does your heart hurt?). It can also be used metaphorically to refer to the center or core of something.
